examples: she paused, at a loss for words

noun.description: A temporary stop in action or speech.
examples: she dropped me outside during a brief pause in the rain
the admiral chattered away without pause

phrases: public outrage has given him pause
I completely understand that, and, to be honest, it gives me pause for thought.
The Athens experience should give us pause for thought.
But the notion of celebrating any culture should give us pause for thought.
This was a good point, and gave me pause for thought.
origin: Late Middle English: from Old French, from Latin pausa, from Greek pausis, from pausein to stop.
